programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games

programme.title: Room 101

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack's not having much luck with lights these days, whether it's the fizzling sign at the start of this show, the blackout during his recent Sheffield gig, or the dimly lit area at the start of this seventh series. Lee and Lucy have enjoyed a spot of culture at their local cinema, but the sparkle of a French movie is soon diminished when the romantic walk home finds them in an imposing underpass. She has her handbag stolen by a bunch of cocky youths from under his nose. Given the fact the layabout failed to protect her, or come up with an accurate description of their muggers, Lee feels the urge to prove his manliness, but will a spell at the local boxing ring be a help or a hindrance? Sally Bretton and Katy Wix also star.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A wealthy new couple move into the block and soon find out that sharing a building with Lee and Lucy is anything but straightforward. The fun begins when Lee somehow manages to bag an invitation to a christening party being thrown by the couple - sending him and Lucy on a last-minute gift-buying trip, during which they make every wrong decision humanly possible to find the perfect present for the baby who seems to have everything. Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden join the cast, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy decides she wants to have a baby, but what she didn't expect was for the whole family to take a personal interest in the conception. Lee thinks he should be the one, of course - so he can't believe it when she reveals she is planning to have the child with another man. Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star, with Katy Wix, Bobby Ball, Geoffrey Whitehead and Deborah Grant.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tries to prove the Nissan GT-R is faster than the celebrated Bullet Train in a race across Japan with Richard Hammond and James May. Newsreaders Fiona Bruce and Kate Silverton are the Stars in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.desc: Five new contestants, James Acaster, Jessica Knappett, Kerry Godliman, Phil Wang and Rhod Gilbert, complete a series of tasks.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which Alan Davies, Jo Brand, Vic Reeves and Clive Anderson answer questions on the theme of espionage. Host Stephen Fry will be awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Jessica Knappett beautifully mimics a funny noise, Phil Wang makes ogres poignant despite his eye-catching costume and James Acaster finds various circles.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave suggests revamping the calendar and considers the upshot of buying Twitter followers.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie decides his staff need to work harder and vows to sack the next employee he catches slacking. Mrs Cakeworthy is the first out the door, but she soon has her boss regretting his decision when he learns she is a witch. John Challis, Sue Holderness and Ella Kenion star.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey describes how Winston Churchill drew on the lessons of his ancestor John to lead the UK through the Second World War. At two key moments, the prime minister's strategic sense helped avert disaster, and in both decisions, the influence of the Duke of Marlborough is apparent. Starkey argues that it was Winston's ability to control events by giving them a narrative meaning that enabled him to shape world history long after his fall from power.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Inside Hitler's Killing Machine
programme.desc: The establishment of the concentration camps, revealing how quickly a system of concentration populations turned into a tool for mass murder.

programme.title: From World War to Cold War
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the end of the Second World War, and how the plans for the future agreed by the Allied nations at the Yalta Conference in 1945 broke down.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates what Hitler intended to do with the priceless works of art stolen by the Nazis from across Europe, as well as his obsession with religious artefacts.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's former deputy Hermann Goering, who emerged from house arrest in May 1945 and made his way to American lines in the hope of surrendering to them rather than the Russians. After being imprisoned at Nuremberg, he committed suicide by poisoning in October 1946.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from Plymouth's Royal William Yard. Items brought in to be valued include a ceremonial wooden spoon presented to the student who got the worst exam results in the history of Cambridge University, one of the last flasks of naval rum to be produced, a book of designs by a famous landscape gardener, a ceremonial hammer and chisel and some dolls' house furniture. One visitor discovers the brooch she bought in a charity shop is much older than she thought.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering that has overcome some of the greatest mountain ranges to create innovative railways, including a tunnel in the Swiss Alps and a zig-zag railway in Ecuador..

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Bolsover Castle in Derbyshire. Finds on display include original illustrations for Roald Dahl's book Fantastic Mr Fox, a set of motorcyclist Barry Sheene's racing leathers, a collection of Star Wars toys, a mysterious metal rod that proves to be far more valuable than it appears and a miniature house used for training plumbers. A visitor to the show tries to find a glass figure for her mother, to replace one that exploded.

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Life in the tropical Atlantic, where everything from dolphins, manatees and whale sharks to sunbathing jellyfish thrive in the Caribbean's warm, sheltered waters, fringed by coral reefs and rich mangrove forests. But when extreme heat in Africa unleashes terrifying hurricanes, all hell breaks loose across the region.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough profiles the tree-dwellers of the animal kingdom, as primates, bats and squirrels perform complicated manoeuvres in the world's forests. Whether aided by sharp claws, webbed feet or gripping tails, these animals play a complicated game of survival with predators lurking below, ready to make a meal of those who fail to stay aloft.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The stories behind the most important trains in history and their impact on the world, beginning with a look at the first locomotives during the Industrial Revolution.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich

programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for a missing train containing Nazi treasure, which was believed to have been hidden in the mountains of Poland.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three rare Alvises get the auction buyers going when put under the hammer. A Chevy Corvette which started its journey in Saudi Arabia makes its way to Thornton le Dale for the sale.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave gets a nasty surprise when he opens the bonnet of a fast Ford from the 80's, and an Austin Heavy 12 nearly a century old sets off a bidding war at the auction.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Mark Radcliffe narrates the first of three special editions of the archive music show focusing on 1960s hits, beginning with tracks by artists including the Foundations, Julie Driscoll, Sandie Shaw and Procol Harum.

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: Another selection of performances from the archives, focusing on hits of the 1960s. Featured artists include Clodagh Rodgers, the Move, Tom Jones and the Bee Gees, plus more from Top of the Pops and other shows from the era. Narrated by Mark Radcliffe.

programme.title: The Rolling Stones at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Exploring the history of Westminster Abbey, which dates back to the 11th century and houses more than 500 corpses, including those of Edward I, Elizabeth I, Charles Darwin and Isaac Newton, as well as staging 16 royal weddings. The episode also explores the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: In 1925 the SS Cotopaxi carrying coal and 32 men vanished. It has since become synonymous with one of the ocean's greatest mysteries - the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the startling similarities between humans and great apes, meeting an orang-utan able to row boats and wash clothes and a gorilla that can communicate using sign language. Drama, starring Tim Healy, Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Open All Hours

programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Drama-documentary revealing the most shocking and surprising murder cases in history. At the time of Jack the Ripper, London was home to some of the most terrible individuals the city has ever seen. One of the very worst was the elusive Borough Poisoner, George Chapman. Presenter Nicholas Day reveals how he was finally brought to justice.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A mile-and-a half of recently-excavated trenches, bunkers, barracks, and gun encasements near Pointe du Hoc, which tell a new story of D-Day.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second programme this year from RAF Coningsby in Lincolnshire, and discovers the story of a length of tree that ended up inside a Lancaster bomber. Treasures brought in to be valued include a harp that survived the French Revolution, a curious wooden item with an unexpected purpose, a diamond brooch found hidden inside a barometer and a pair of Second World War propaganda posters printed on hessian sacking.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the startling similarities between humans and great apes, meeting an orang-utan able to row boats and wash clothes and a gorilla that can communicate using sign language. He also traces the history of human settlement and considers the future of population control and food production.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A closer look at a sprawling Wild West ghost town that sits peaceful and abandoned in Montana, USA, but is still haunted by tales of murder, corruption and buried treasure.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Walmer castle, Kent, and is challenged to identify a valuable 18th-century glass out of a collection of reproductions. Other items brought in to be valued include a rare pottery piglet, a revolving table with secret compartments, a British PoW's diary, a set of French fashion illustrations from the 1920s, a table clock and a collection of Victorian ceramic birds.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: A tour of the mightiest rivers in the world, from the deep waters of Siberia's Lake Baikal, home to the world's only freshwater seal, to the wetlands downstream of Earth's tallest waterfall patrolled by frenzied piranhas. There is also footage of the lightning-quick ambush of wildebeest by crocodiles in Africa and macaque monkeys swimming underwater to catch crabs in Indonesia. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California.

programme.title: Wartime Crime

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet

Meanwhile, Neville's loyalties are tested when he is ordered to spy on a Manchester United fan, and Dennis begins to feel left out. Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Kevin Whately star.

programme.desc: The duo are hired to create a garden as a wedding present, and find a baby under a gooseberry bush. Their task is complicated by the murder of an artistic neighbour - and the two mysterious incidents appear to be connected. Starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo visit a resort in Spain to create a trophy garden for a pro-am tennis tournament run by a former champion. While investigating, Laura enters the mysterious world of bullfighting, and Rosemary rediscovers her love of motor scooters.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. A member of the cast gets an attack of stage fright, and Laura is obliged to take her place in the play as the duo try to find the culprit. Drama, with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.desc: An avid cyclist suffers a massive coronary at the top of a local mountain, but with astronomical levels of caffeine in his system, there is more to his death than meets the eye.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Sid falls for the heiress to a local brewery, only for her to be arrested for the murder of her own father. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: After three months back in 2010, Alex is desperate to return to the 1980s, where Gene is on the run accused of trying to kill her, and the team is in disarray with Ray promoted to DI and a child's kidnapping to investigate. As the past merges into the present, she is visited by the ghost of a dead policeman and realises there are still dark secrets to unearth. Drama, starring Keeley Hawes and Philip Glenister.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: A serial killer targets women signed up to a dating agency, so Alex puts aside her examination of Sam Tyler's death back in Manchester to go undercover. However, as it becomes clear that Shaz matches the profile of previous victims, she steps forward to snare the murderer - an act set to be her last as a police officer. Fantasy crime drama, starring Keeley Hawes and Monserrat Lombard, with Beth Goddard.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: Drama based on the last days of cult leader David Koresh, and the 51-day siege between February and April 1993 at a compound belonging to his religious sect. In the first episode, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms (ATF) receives a tip-off of suspicious activity involving weapons taking place among a small religious community led by David Koresh at the Mount Carmel Center, located just outside of Waco, Texas. Starring Taylor Kitsch, Michael Shannon, Melissa Benoist and John Leguizamo.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: ATF agent Jacob Vasquez begins undercover surveillance on the Mount Carmel compound and befriends David Koresh in hope of finding illegal weapons or other activity.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: With the ATF siege in motion, assault vehicles storm the Mount Carmel compound and exchange gunfire, which begins a 51-day stand-off.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. However, the production suffers a setback when an actor shoots himself during rehearsal - and the gun is found to have contained live bullets instead of blanks. A member of the cast gets an attack of stage fright, and Laura is obliged to take her place in the play as the duo try to find the culprit. Drama, with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters and Samantha Nixon continue to hunt for the missing Lesley Palmer - a case given added urgency by the subsequent disappearance of her ex-boyfriend Stewart Jenson. Smithy and Laura Bryant discover the unidentified hospital patient is June's real son, while Terry Perkins and Phil Hunter investigate a sudden death - but soon find they also have a burglary on their hands.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Smithy discovers Gabriel's real name is actually David Kent. Understandably taken aback, he nevertheless prevents June from telling Okaro. Unfortunately Laura also knows the truth, and lacks his resolve. Filled with righteous indignation, she blurts out the entire sorry saga to a shell-shocked Sheelagh - who blunders headlong into danger as she investigates. On the professional front, Terry investigates an attack on his sister-in-law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: David Kent returns home unexpectedly and catches wife-to-be Sheelagh going through his belongings. Realising time is running out, he resorts to desperate measures and tries to kill the real Gabriel. Later, as a horrified June looks on, he and Smithy settle their differences once and for all - in a life-or-death struggle on the roof of a tower block.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: A young Idris Elba puts in an appearance at the Thrift Infirmary, as Lady Cora's pregnant maid is rushed in with labour pains, causing Robert's reluctant return..

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor comes up against the governors of the East London Hospital when they threaten to take over the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah is concerned about the risks involved in Rene's brain operation and refuses to give her consent, while George steps down as the Country Party candidate and attempts to face his demons regarding his strained relationship with his father. Elizabeth comes home from Sydney to attend Georgie's christening and Gino is worried about his vine saplings.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: James's continued absence leaves Olivia distraught on the morning of Georgie's christening. An anxious Sarah is comforted by Dr Fox.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth spots a strange man in Elizabeth's house and becomes convinced he has spent the night there.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth's wealthy acquaintance Mrs Fortescue, whose sister married a baronet, asks her for a lift into town - but things do not go according to plan. Patricia Routledge stars.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth plans a candlelit supper to impress Emmet with her singing talents, but fate intervenes and the event does not go as expected. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and David Griffin.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is reunited with a couple whose daughter was born without limbs, and takes them to a specialist unit where she can be fitted for prosthetics. However, while the experience helps the girl's mother to realise that she is not alone, it proves traumatic for the father, who blames his wife for his child's condition. Nurse Crane takes charge of Sister Winifred's driving lessons, and Trixie thinks Christopher is hiding something from her.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: Simon's dead body is found by the river, leaving everyone in a state of shock. Harrow is surprised about all the things he did not know about his protege. The investigator also attends the scene of an accidental electrocution, whom it transpires was the last person Simon spoke to last before his death. Ioan Gruffudd stars.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A body found hanging in the children's playground of a recently regenerated model community proves to be that of a member of the local Community Watch scheme. Suspicion falls on the chairman of the organisation Harry Wallace, a founding father who helped clean up the estate for the residents. Reid fights to clear the local hero's name, but her colleagues are not so easily impressed when it emerges he has form for accidentally killing a man. Glasgow-set detective drama, guest starring Phil McKee, with Blythe Duff.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: The Branch Davidians refuse to surrender, while David Koresh waits for a sign from God and his followers are tested by a lack of food and medicine.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: The end of the stalemate seems to approach as the FBI's tactical division turns up the heat.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: Attorneys visit David Koresh and his followers to discuss the case at hand and options. However, the stand-off at the Mount Carmel compound ultimtely comes to a violent and tragic end. Taylor Kitsch and Michael Shannon star.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: In the final episode, the fusiliers attend the funeral of Tony Wilton. Elsewhere, Donna decides that it is time to move out.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Dave loses his temper when Donna tells him the truth about their son. Meanwhile, Stubbs struggles with life as an officer. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela investigates a 'happy slapping' incident. Tracing the teenage culprits to a nearby school, she finds they show no remorse. Amber, Ramani and Zain look into a case of domestic violence, only to find the circumstances aren't as clear-cut as they initially appeared. Back at the station, Dan Casper is teased about his seemingly non-existent love life, and Adam tries to quell gossip about the bogus Gabriel Kent's fatal fall.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tricia learns her operation has been postponed but is shocked to find out how far Mark will go to get her back on the list. Elliot is forced to confront his grief when James turns up at the hospital wanting answers about Gina's death, and Lola tries to juggle the demands of work with interviews to find a nanny for Leanne. Meanwhile, tension mounts between Ric and Abra over the illegal pig's kidney scheme.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Andrew is surprised by Duffy's absence from work, unaware she's pregnant and has morning sickness, while a medical emergency forces two estranged sisters to reconcile their differences. Chloe helps reunite a quarrelling couple, and Barney lands himself in trouble in a nightclub. Medical drama, starring Philip Bretherton and Jan Anderson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amber continues to tease Dan about his love life. Goaded by her constant jibes, he reluctantly admits to dating a married woman - much to the anger of Rochelle. Zain looks into the case of an Egyptian girl who has been reported missing twice in one day. Leela makes a grisly discovery, and Jo Masters goes undercover to investigate a series of drug overdoses at a private prison - only to encounter a figure from her past.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nellie has some news for Arthur. Frank is having to face up to reality.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Things look bad for Michelle until Auntie Nelly steps in, while Mark comes up against Ian's greed.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team search desperately for casualties as the fire on the private railway line blazes on. Meanwhile, Carole confronts Martin.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Idealistic medic Jack Kerruish (Kevin Whately) helps resolve a confused priest's doubts about his mental state, and begins flirting with an attractive trainee GP working at rival health centre The Beeches. Rural drama, also starring Amanda Burton and Jaye Griffiths.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Ozias is determined to ruin the factory, despite suffering a personal crisis, and a former cabaret star has her work cut out trying to make up for lost time with the daughter she sacrificed for a glittering career. Beth goes into labour during a day out with the local widows, while Nathan and Joe fight over Alice. Drama, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Sian Reeves, with Brian Capron and Kerrie Taylor.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Darryl is feeling the effects of two years in prison, prompting Dorien to offer her own brand of advice. Comedy, starring Alun Lewis and Lesley Joseph.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Elgin spots a money-making opportunity when he finds out two psychic detectives are offering 5,000 for a photograph of a ghost. Meanwhile, Tyler prepares for his first gig with Puddle of Agony, but worries his credibility will be ruined when Boycie and Marlene decide to accompany him.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo accidently discards something of sentimental value, and waxes lyrical about the two subjects closest to his heart - love and ferrets. Meanwhile, Seymour demonstrates his new home security device. Long-running rural comedy, starring Bill Owen and Michael Aldridge.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour reveals his latest invention - a purse for men. Compo agrees to test the product, which results in minor havoc. Comedy, with Bill Owen, Michael Aldridge and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Tragedy strikes a leading football club when the team bus is hit by a train and the post-mortem examination reveals it was not an accident. Among the victims is manager Martin Bendelow, whose family has more than its fair share of skeletons in the cupboard, and more secrets are revealed when another murder takes place. Stephen Beckett guest stars, with Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team re-examines the murder of a junior doctor strangled in 2010. Interviewing her relatives, who are all doctors, staff at her hospital and a surgeon who had been the young woman's tutor, officers hope to identify a lead that was missed during the original investigation. Depressed at the thought of his daughter Holly leaving home for university, Danny finds himself being cheered by his colleagues as they hire a pedibus for a ride through central London. Tamzin Outhwaite and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam and Harry investigate when a gruesome, partly mummified corpse is found after a lorry crashes into an old factory building. The forensic experts attempt to identify the remains by reconstructing the skull, while DCI Telford and DS Linden track down a woman who claims the body is that of a former boyfriend who disappeared seven years previously. It soon transpires that the deceased had unsavoury connections. Benedict Cumberbatch makes an early screen appearance, alongside stars Amanda Burton, William Gaminara and Tom Ward.

programme.desc: Abra tells a patient he will be able to get his hands on HIV medication for her brother in Zambia, but as he searches for drugs in the basement with a torch, Ric sneaks up on him and turns the light on. Meanwhile, Elliot works a night shift to take his mind off Gina, and Matt tries to scare Donna by talking about the paranormal.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An emergency prompts Duffy to tell Andrew she's pregnant, and a lonely widower clashes with his neighbour over a large wooden Santa. Meanwhile, Charlie worries about Barney's seemingly uncontrollable temper, and Patrick receives bad news.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jo Masters goes undercover as a warder at Stonewall prison to investigate the source of drugs which have led to a spate of overdoses. Yvonne Hemmingway comes across an old flame involved in a shooting case and is forced to arrest him for concealing vital evidence, while Dan Casper's affair with commander's wife Rochelle Barratt is strained when they clash over a professional matter. Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard reveals his true colours to Bianca. Natalie delivers some shocking news. Ian decides to claim his inheritance; where does this leave Mark? Phil gets another bargain.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Bianca finds out that Richard is not easily fooled.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: On an exchange trip to Holland, Nick is reunited with Marianne. Meanwhile, Blue Watch are called to a blaze at a fire station.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack and Beth disagree over the treatment of a young patient with a heart defect, while Sarah and Will's marriage deteriorates as their financial problems mount.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Harding announces his plans for the factory and whether he and Alice intend to stay in Skelthwaite permanently, while Sally and Billy make an important decision about their future. At the village summer fete, David and Anna go public about their relationship and are stunned by a surprise from Luke.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: A stranger asks for help with a leaking car radiator shortly before police turn up at the house, but it transpires he has a hidden agenda. Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson star.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Marlene spots an opportunity to have her old possessions assessed by experts when the Antiques Roadshow arrives in Ludlow, and the farm's staff all share the same idea. However, it turns out that Boycie, with help from Tyler, is the only one to discover a truly valuable item. Fiona Bruce guest stars.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour invents a car safety device and as soon as he hears Nora Batty is to attend its demonstration, Compo volunteers to be the dummy that tests it. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio decide there is profit to be made from a heatwave, so Seymour designs a vendor's side car cooler to put Compo into business as an ice-cream man. Comedy, starring Michael Aldridge and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Charlie is appointed to defend an animal rights activist accused of murdering an eminent scientist - a case that will be heard before her father. The defence barrister's support for her client's cause leads her to make a series of unprofessional outbursts in court, while Jo's relationship with Marc Thompson creates tension.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team looks into the death of a terrorist 30 years previously after his daughter receives an anonymous note claiming he was murdered - an investigation that takes them right back to the Greenham Common anti-nuclear protests. Meanwhile, Sasha agrees to go for dinner with her ex-husband Ned, which he is hoping will lead to a reconciliation. Tamzin Outhwaite and Dennis Waterman star, with guest appearances from Barnaby Kay, Charlotte Cornwell and Patricia Potter.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A police cadet's body is found, and it soon transpires that his demise mirrors the death of another murder victim killed months previously. When Sam Ryan and her forensic team investigate, they discover the dead man's training college could prove vital in solving the crime. Acclaimed drama series, starring Amanda Burton, with a guest appearance by Tim Healy.

programme.title: Casualty

Drama, starring Derek Thompson and Cathy Shipton, with a guest appearance by Windsor Davies.

Pauline Quirke guest stars.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark comes up against Ian's greed when he puts a business proposal to him. Bianca & Natalie get revenge on Richard. Steve gets his come-uppance when an old score is settled.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard finds himself at the centre of an escalating nuisance campaign. Cindy decides to give a surprise birthday party for Ian.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Gregg's romance with Tiggy develops, and Blue Watch are called out to deal with a massive blaze at a used-car lot. Starring Steven Houghton.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Will desperately tries to make up with the ambitious Sarah and comes up with a plan to clear their debts, but his actions have dire consequences. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Danny Flint finds his bachelor lifestyle cut short by his sister's death, leaving him in charge of nine-year-old niece Cady. Meanwhile, Beth's efforts to balance motherhood and a nursing career pose a dilemma, and Anna and David finally tie the knot. Guest starring Elizabeth Spriggs, with Kerrie Taylor, Lesley Dunlop and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: An encounter with an old flame makes Sharon feel broody, while Tracey has her work cut out pampering Garth in the school holidays. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: To celebrate her 40th wedding anniversary, Marlene wants to renew her marriage vows with Boycie, and tries to make contact with old friends while compiling the guest list - only to receive devastating news. Comedy, starring John Challis and Sue Holderness.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo and Clegg hatch a devious plan to free henpecked Wally and Howard from their wives - if only for a few hours. Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: After Clegg is visited by three teenage missionaries, Seymour believes it is about time he offered his considerable talents and services to the local vicar, so sets about selling tickets for its staging of The Tales of Beatrix Potter. Peter Sallis and Michael Aldridge star.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The inspector and his ambitious sergeant John Bacchus investigate the murder of Dolores Kenny, a black woman. She is a regular attender of a local club's soul all-nighters, events popular with factory workers from across the racial divide. Gently begins to uncover evidence of prejudice within the local community and his own police force as he seeks to identify the victim's killer. Detective drama set in 1968, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Lenora Crichlow, Craig Conway, Pippa Bennett-Warner and Maggie O'Neill.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman with dementia runs away from her care home and turns up at a south London police station to report a murder - sparking a reinvestigation into the mysterious disappearance of her police officer husband in 1956. The official report says that he fell into the river after one too many beers - but what secrets was this seemingly straight-as-a die old-fashioned bobby keeping? Meanwhile, Steve's son is arrested for buying weed, bringing the retired cop face to face with his ex-wife - a woman he hasn't seen in 10 years. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance from Julie Graham.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: When a government minister is killed by a fire in a London hotel, terrorists are suspected of starting the blaze _ until Leo discovers a wad of notes on the MP's bed. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan tries to uncover the truth, but finds her investigations are hampered by a former schoolfriend who claims to work for the Cabinet Office. Amanda Burton and William Gaminara star.

programme.title: Freeze Out
programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a giant game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of 10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, which sees five bankers competing to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of popular culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another comical selection of mishaps sent in by viewers, featuring accidents filmed using the latest technology only - no camcorder clips or pixelated phone videos in sight. Tonight, a man is accidentally tasered, a couple set their kitchen on fire, and a toddler in an electric car runs amok in a shopping centre.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty presents as eight celebrity families take part in the knockout tournament, hoping to win 25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The first episode is a battle of the soaps, as Coronation Street's Lucy Fallon (Bethany Platt) and her family take on former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson (Barry Evans) and his clan. Two new rounds have been added to this celebrity spin on the format - including an Observation round featuring cartoon images of Anne that put their memories to the test.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Scammers: Hunting the Lockdown Criminals - Tonight
programme.desc: There has been a spike in internet fraud - from fake goods and services to con artists impersonating the authorities through emails, texts, calls and even appearing at people's front doors. Paul Connolly investigates the unscrupulous crooks using the lockdown to prey on others.

programme.title: Police Tapes
programme.sub-title: The Murder of Rhys Jones: Police Tapes
programme.desc: When 11-year-old Rhys Jones was shot dead on his way home from weekly football practice in 2007, his family was left shattered and police were left with a case that seemed impenetrable. But when certain names were mentioned again and again, the police planted secret bugs in the homes of these gang members. Here, Susanna Reid gains unprecedented access to the subsequent recordings, where those responsible admit their part and the lengths they would go to cover up the crime. She also talks to Rhys's parents, Mel and Steve, about the impact of this appalling crime.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Kim Cattrall is the first guest as the chat show returns, with the actress revealing why she turned down Sex and the City 3 and talking about her relationship with the other cast members following rumoured feuds. She also opens up to Piers about her three marriages and discusses why she was forced to pull out of a West End play.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A London softball team, dubbed the Portland Pirates, answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks that Fizz is a hat he is going to wear for his romantic date with Marnie. That's bad enough, but Fizz has a very important job to do!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: At the supermarket, Magoo mixes his shopping cart up with a baby stroller. Fizz decides to save the toddler and become a media star..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks Weasel has opened a restaurant, and wants to help him improve it. He mistakes the FizzLab for a kitchen!.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The Mikkelsens have pizza and the raccoons will do anything to get it. Can Mike hold them off for long enough for his owners to enjoy their dinner?.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons break into the Mikkelsens' and Mercury stumbles upon a didgeridoo and just can't get enough of it. Can Mike shut them up?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean looks back over his life, recalling how he acquired his beloved teddy bear and learned to drive. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A mysterious furry pink animal moves in with Bean, who doesn't know what it is but can't bring himself to get rid of such an odd creature.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Get ready for awesome action adventures with Rath! Taking out villains is all part of the fun for this hero. His mission - to save the day!.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Sickening Fumes of Smartsy Fartsy
programme.desc: The boys create a smart gas cloud to steal Mr Krupp's rulebook, but it turns against them..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: If there were two things Dave could wish for it would be for Fuzzypeg to smell better, and for Gran to be nicer. Is getting what you want always a good thing?.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James presents more highlights from the series, as well as preparing prawn biryani, French onion soup, and fig gateau, and providing a masterclass on steamed sponge pudding. Plus, James' culinary tour of Cornwall and recipes from chefs Clare Smyth, Atul Kochhar and Richard Bertinet.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Clare Smyth for a tour of the Lake District. They visit the Windermere Jetty Museum and take a trip on the lake in a traditional steam-powered boat. They also visit the farmers who supply the meat for Clare's restaurant and discover the secrets behind the region's famous sticky toffee pudding.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott is still in the eastern Mediterranean country of Jordan. In the seaside city of Aqaba he uses local molasses in a fattoush salad, and cooks with the chefs at a swanky golf club, where roasted fish with spicy rice is the order of the day. Ainsley also visits the city of Petra, learning the history of the Bedouin people and exploring the astonishing Treasury building. Back in his kitchen, chicken shawarma with tahini sauce and pitta bread packed with spiced beef mince are the final dishes on the menu.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his team are in Doncaster, where Stewart Hofgartner assesses a vintage camera and Fay Rutter hopes to pocket a handsome timepiece.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five university friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 2018 World Cup: England v Colombia - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces a look back at the memorable last-16 tie at Otkritie Arena, Moscow, which was decided by a penalty shootout. Original coverage presented by Mark Pougatch, with analysis from Ian Wright, Lee Dixon and Gary Neville, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara host the grand final of the obstacle course challenge, with the final five competitors from across the nation testing their strength, speed and courage. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian takes a trip down memory lane as he presents a series of classic TV game shows, which have all been updated with a new final round offering the contestants a chance to win big. The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. The hopefuls are daytime stalwarts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, comedian Chris Ramsey and his wife Rosie, presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia, and singer-actress Martine McCutcheon and her husband Jack McManus.

programme.title: Captain America: Civil War (2016)
programme.desc: The superhuman soldier is propelled into conflict with his Avengers teammate Iron Man over a system of government control over their actions - a situation made worse when an old friend is accused of being behind a terror attack. As a cunning conspiracy surrounds them all, Captain America finds himself battling former allies, vengeful enemies, and new heroes on the block Black Panther and Spider-Man. Superhero adventure, starring Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of 10 giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to 10,000

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Weasel (in an animal costume) for a groundhog being hunted, and confiscates the hunter's gun..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz is at the pool, he wants to start sub-marine hairdressing! But Magoo, thinks he is fishing in a lake, and starts trying to catch Weasel..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike's owner buys him a pair of cute new shoes for his paws. Mike isn't pleased by the new footwear at all and they make some seriously awful squeaking noises.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons break into the Mikkelsens house again and Mike is easily defeated during a fight against the determined crooks.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean plans a romantic meal with his girlfriend, only to fall asleep while the main course is in the oven. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean is forced to retrieve a tennis ball from the roof of a house across the road, but gets paralysed by vertigo 60ft up and has to rely on a hamster to steer him to safety. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: A mysterious electrical storm downs the Omni-Copter.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Troublesome Treachery of The...
programme.desc: The boys face off against the Toot Fairy while trying to get Mr Krupp fired..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave gets a girlfriend who turns out to be an alien. And she turns out to bear a striking similarity to an everyday household item..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Anna is practising for the school cycling test and is good at it. Dave isn't quite as skilled, but with a new bike from his parents he really hopes to pass..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Michelin-starred chef Lisa Goodwin-Allen on a visit to the Isle of Man during the warm-up week for the famous TT race. James serves up proper biker food - pork burgers with a spicy apple sauce - and picks up some local Manx kippers to make soup. Lisa visits local organic juice producers before James joins TT legend John McGuinness as he and his team prepare for the race, treating the bikers to lamb chops with hispi cabbage and an olive glaze.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Nurse Maggie Simkiss cares for end of life patients and treats their emotional well-being as well as their direct medical needs. To say thank you for her hard work, Alan Titchmarsh and his team of green-fingered experts arrive at her Hull home and help transform the unkempt garden into a grown-up Mediterranean hideaway.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Advice on growing fruit and vegetables, with Alan sharing the tips and tricks he uses on his own plot, with his Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney joining in from their homes. From seriously stylish ways to grow veg anywhere to practical tips on what to plant and where, they show how to get gardens bursting with fruit, salad, herbs and vegetables to supply the table for the year ahead and beyond.

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.sub-title: The Good, The Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: Martin learns about animal exploitation - the good, the bad and the ugly. The actor visits Sri Lanka, where fishing for manta rays is legal, but a turtle sanctuary offers hope. In Thailand, he learns more about silk production - as well as a more animal-friendly alternative - and on the Australian Friday Island, he is shown the delicate art of growing pearls. Finally, in the Abrolhos islands, Martin learns about the most valuable catch in Australia's waters.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle attends the annual Ennerdale Show in the Lake District, where he takes part in some sheep-showing and gets to grips with some Cumbrian wrestling, while Liz Bonnin heads to the River Nith in south-west Scotland for a training day with the river rescue team. Guest reporter Sheila Hancock returns to the quiet corner of the Dorset coast where she first fell in love with the countryside almost 80 years ago.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty presents as eight celebrity families take part in this knockout tournament, hoping to win 25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park (1997)
programme.desc: Scientist Dr Ian Malcolm reluctantly joins a research team on the island where his employer first designed genetically engineered dinosaurs. Meanwhile, a big-game hunter takes the chance to bag the biggest prize of all - a Tyrannosaurus rex. Steven Spielberg's dinosaur adventure sequel, starring Jeff Goldblum, Julianne Moore, Pete Postlethwaite and Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Adam Garcia, Carol Decker, Holly Walsh and Rylan Clark-Neal pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)
programme.desc: British author Newt Scamander arrives in 1920s New York with a bagful of magical creatures as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but gets caught up in a conflict when some of the creatures in his care are accidentally released. With a strange dark force terrorising the city, Newt needs to find some allies to help him round-up the beasts, while saving his own skin in the meantime. Harry Potter prequel, starring Eddie Redmayne, Katherine Waterston and Colin Farrell.

programme.title: Die Another Day (2002)
programme.desc: James Bond is suspended from duty after being taken hostage in North Korea, but goes against orders to track down those who betrayed him. During the pursuit of the terrorist he was investigating before his capture, he discovers a connection with a British billionaire who has constructed a devastating orbital weapon. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Halle Berry, Toby Stephens, Judi Dench and John Cleese.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Andrea struggles seeing Jamie and Belle together, but hatches a plan to tear them apart, and uses the quiz night at the Woolpack to make their affair a very public matter. Rhona and Moira clash during a client meeting, while Rishi hides his alarm when he reads what appears to be a love letter from Wendy addressed to him.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff gains entry to Number 6 to delete the CCTV footage, Roy finds Shona lurking outside the caf, and Dev decides to move the twins to Oakhill School.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossain puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan shows how to grow a summer feast of strawberries, even if the only space available is a doorstep, and family-friendly ways to grow delicious vegetables. His Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney join in from their homes with clever hacks and tips to get viewers making the most out of their gardens, window boxes or windowsills.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of people who were abandoned as babies, helping them try to find their birth families and know their identities. David McBride was left in a car as a two-week-old infant in January 1962, while Helen Ward was left in a tartan bag in a telephone box in Dundalk in 1968.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten

programme.title: Les Dawson Forever
programme.desc: The first of two programmes celebrating the career of the Manchester-born comedy star. Les's youngest daughter Charlotte Dawson meets Opportunity Knocks director Royston Mayoh to hear how an audition would change her father's life for ever, Les's comedy partner Roy Barraclough reminisces about their famous characters Cissie and Ada, and Barry Cryer returns to Yorkshire Television to revisit some of Les's friends.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 2018 World Cup: England v Colombia - ITV Football Classics
programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke introduces a look back at the memorable last-16 tie at Otkritie Arena, Moscow, which was decided by a penalty shootout. Original coverage presented by Mark Pougatch, with analysis from Ian Wright, Lee Dixon and Gary Neville, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle.

programme.title: Culinary Genius
programme.desc: The final three contenders have just two minutes to select from the larder containing a stunning array of fresh fruit and vegetables, pulses and grains, condiments and sauce ingredients to work in conjunction with crab meat. They then have 25 minutes to concoct a sumptuous meal. With a trio of Mediterranean-ispired crab dishes on the menu, judge Rosemary Shrager faces a mouth-watering feast before she must make the ultimate decision, upon which rests a 1,000 cash prize. Presented by Fern Britton.

programme.desc: In the final episode of the ninth series, Martin rushes to Ruth's for a medical emergency, and preparations for Morwenna and Al's wedding do not go to plan. Elsewhere, Martin takes his final GMC assessment under the watchful eye of eminent surgeon Bernard Newton, who monitors Martin's skills in assisted surgery. Starring Martin Clunes, Tom Conti, Caroline Catz and Jessica Ransom.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the quiz, with six more contestants competing in Fastest Finger First to see who will sit in the hot seat and have the chance to take home the 1million jackpot. To make things easier, the players have four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal.

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help two more people who were found as babies after being abandoned to track down their birth families. Simon Jeffery was left in a box outside a railway tavern in Greenhithe, a story which hit the headlines but which he only learned about by chance at the age of 10. Fi Beazer was discovered in a public toilet in Warminster when she was only a few hours old. Both have spent their adult life trying to track down their parents, and submit DNA samples in the hope of finally getting the answers they seek.

programme.title: Les Dawson Forever

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Manchester-born brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on an epic journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the fifth episode, Adam attempts to master an ancient sport when he and Scott get a taste of Indian parklife. Elsewhere, Ryan and Dougie make a shock discovery about Dougie's grandmother, before the group join in with the festivities for the country's biggest party for Diwali.

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: In the sixth and final episode, the brothers prepare to say their goodbyes to Mumbai, but before they leave, they are invited to appear on a local news report. For their final stop in the city, the boys meet 85-year-old Norma Otter, who was a team-mate of Dougie's international hockey star aunt, Pansy Thomas. Following the meeting, the boys decide to take on a junior girl's hockey team who are training nearby. As their adventure draws to a close, the family arrive in Jejuri in the midst of the 100,000 festival goers who are there to take part in what is known as the Golden Festival.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a nine-month-old terrier who was found wandering the streets whilst heavily pregnant, before spending time with a three-month-old puppy called Pancake, who is having problems with his eyesight. Elsewhere, a dog arrives at Battersea who was found dumped with a terrible case of mange and an injured leg.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh: Happy 60th Birthday
programme.desc: In honour of his 60th birthday, this special programme celebrates the illustrious career of Bradley Walsh, from stand-up comedy and presenting, to quiz shows and acting. Presented by Jason Manford.
